My Resume

Let me show you my experience...

BIO

I'm a passionate Computer Science Major interested in the IT and Cybersecurity fields. I worked with Trilogy Educations as a Teacher's Aide for UT Austin's very first Cybersecurity Boot Camp and currently assist the Texas Department of Family and Protective Services providing technical support to employees around the state.

GCS Systems Support Specialist I

Texas Department of Family Protective Services
Oct 2018 - Present

I currently work in the Department of Family and Protective Services as a Tier 1 Tech Support Specialist. I am responsible for providing swift resolutions to fix various problems, and provide documentation though the Remedy ticketing system for problems that need to be escalated. This includes providing technical support for teleworkers and others in branching offices outside of Austin. In addition, I play a critical role as being the first point of contact for various outages.

Teacher's Aide

UT Austin / 2U
Jan 2019 - Jul 2019

I helped guide a class of students with no prior experience in programming or networking to become knowledgeable superstars in the Cybersecurity world. This 24-week course covered an array of topics, from Kali Linux and the many tools included with it, to high level concepts such as governance risk compliance, SIEM, and Malware Analysis. I was responsible for helping students figure out tough concepts and encouraging them to pursue further learning outside of the classroom. While I did function as a mentor, I also practiced and learned many other concepts as a student. It helped bolster my confidence not only in my abilities, but reassured me that Cybersecurity was the industry that I wanted to spend the rest of my life in.

Lab Assistant

Central Texas College
Jun 2018 - Oct 2018

I was responsible for maintaining the Computer Information and Technology Systems numerous computer labs. While I worked here, I learned many basic troubleshooting and computer maintenance concepts and it served as valuable groundwork experience. I had participated in many special projects while performing my duties of guiding college students through troubleshooting their work. Firstly, I created a map of all ports within each of the labs, and their corresponding positions on the network rack for the entire building. Secondly, I helped setup a secondary network rack for students pursuing IT careers to tinker and work within their classes. Finally, I created a Standard Operating Proceedures guide for Veyon, a student monitoring software for teachers to use to create a more interactive space within the classroom.

Education

Associates, Programmer Analyst, Central Texas College
2015 - 2018

I gained my interest in Programming and Cybersecurity through my time in Central Texas College. I learned various programming languages and concepts, and in addition many networking and security concepts. While attending, I participated in the National Cyber League and placed within the top 12% of participants. Additionally, I worked as a courseware developer for the National CyberWatch Center with assistance from my professor who helped entice my curiosity in the world of Cybersecurity.
